channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Early results from coronavirus vaccine trial show promise
Norway PM's warning to travelers
Top adviser warns China vulnerable to second wave
item.description: China still faces the "big challenge" of a potential second wave of Covid-19 infections, the country's top respiratory authority has warned, with the lack of immunity among the community a serious concern as the race to develop a vaccine continues. CNN's David Culver has the exclusive interview with Dr. Zhong Nanshan.

item.title: As hospitals in Brazil teeter on the brink of collapse, Bolsonaro does pushups with supporters
item.description: The health care system in Brazil's largest city is wavering on the brink of collapse and coronavirus deaths throughout the South American nation are soaring -- but President Jair Bolsonaro nonetheless reveled in crowds of supporters on Sunday, joining yet another anti-lockdown protest in Brasilia.

item.title: Trip of a lifetime with no end in sight: Life on the small boats stuck at sea
item.description: While 38-year-olds Leslie and Andrew Godfrey enjoyed a five-day, 750-mile sailing passage from Sri Lanka to the Maldives, the whole world changed.

item.title: How Trump wins again, in 3 sentences
Pompeo says he asked for inspector general to be fired because he was 'undermining' State Dept.
item.description: Secretary of State Mike Pompeo told The Washington Post on Monday that he had recommended that State Department Inspector General Steve Linick be fired because the independent watchdog was "undermining" the department and wasn't performing in a way that the top US diplomat wanted him to.

item.title: Trump is encouraging supporters to confront reporters
item.description: CNN's Brian Stelter says President Donald Trump's cycle of anti-media attacks present challenges for members of the press.

item.title: US coronavirus death toll approaches 90,000
China backs WHO coronavirus investigation on one condition
Germany and France try to break deadlock over how to rescue the EU
item.description: Germany and France unveiled an initiative Monday aimed at rescuing the European Union from the toughest crisis in its history and bridging the deep national divisions that have stalled progress on a pandemic recovery fund.

item.title: Myanmar police make Asia's biggest drug bust in decades, seizing 200 million meth tablets
item.description: Myanmar police have made Asia's biggest drug bust in decades, seizing hundreds of millions of dollars worth of contraband including "unprecedented" amounts of methylfentanyl, a chemical used to make a dangerously potent synthetic opioid.

item.title: CEO of Europe's largest airline calls UK quarantine plans 'idiotic'
Man interviewed over rail worker's coronavirus death after alleged spitting incident
item.description: Police have interviewed a man in connection with an incident in which a rail worker died from coronavirus after allegedly being spat on at a London train station.

item.title: Super cyclone heads toward India and Bangladesh
item.description: A powerful cyclone that formed in the Bay of Bengal is headed directly for the India-Bangladesh border, bringing with it the potential for major destruction and upheaval in two countries that are still battling the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Hurricanes, typhoons and cyclones are becoming stronger, according to a new NOAA study
item.description: It is becoming increasingly evident that hurricanes, typhoons, and tropical cyclones worldwide are becoming stronger and potentially more deadly as the globe warms due to the climate crisis, according to a new study.

item.title: Congress just did something it hasn't done in a decade
item.description: Congress is like the dentist. You know it's there and that you occasionally have to deal with it. But that doesn't make it pleasant.

item.title: Barr doesn't expect review of Russia probe will 'lead to a criminal investigation' of Obama and Biden
item.description: Attorney General William Barr on Monday said Barack Obama and Joe Biden are unlikely to be under criminal investigation in a review of the Russia probe that began in 2016 -- addressing simmering accusations by President Donald Trump against his predecessor and his 2020 opponent.

item.title: Videos show multiple people trespassed at home Ahmaud Arbery visited. He was the only one killed
item.description: Ahmaud Arbery was shot and killed while jogging in Brunswick, Georgia, on February 23, 2020.

item.title: Democrats tell Supreme Court they need Mueller grand jury docs to decide on new impeachment articles
item.description: The Democratic-led House of Representatives on Monday told the Supreme Court that the House needs secret Mueller grand jury materials to determine if there is new evidence of impeachable offenses involving President Donald Trump.

item.title: Gov. Cuomo takes Covid-19 test during live briefing
item.description: New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo got a coronavirus test during his daily news briefing, saying "it is so fast and so easy that even the governor can take this test."

item.title: Soccer team apologizes for allegedly filling stands with sex dolls
item.description: South Korean football team FC Seoul has apologized after fans accused the club of using sex dolls to fill empty stands at its second game of the K League season.

item.title: Gold nears an eight-year high
item.description: Gold prices have soared this year, and some experts think they could eventually pass the all-time high north of $1,900 an ounce.

item.title: Two Pakistani women murdered in so-called honor killing after a leaked video circulates online
item.description: Two women in Pakistan have been murdered in a so-called "honor killing" after a video showing them kissing a man circulated online.

item.title: Hong Kong lawmakers scuffle as pro-Beijing politicians clear path for controversial bill
item.description: There were scuffles in Hong Kong's parliament Monday as lawmakers fought for control of a key committee chair.

item.title: Atlas V launches for US Space Force mission
item.description: The United Launch Alliance launched its Atlas V rocket for the new government agency's mission, which includes deploying a small satellite and conducting experiments for NASA

item.title: Ryan Seacrest didn't have a stroke during 'American Idol' finale, rep says
item.description: Ryan Seacrest wants fans to know he's OK.

item.title: Hannah Brown, 'Bachelorette' star, apologizes for using the N-word
item.description: It was a rap song which got Hannah Brown in hot water.

item.title: Dwayne Johnson says his mind is blown by daughter Simone following him into WWE
item.description: Dwayne Johnson says he is "very proud" that his 18-year-old daughter is following in his footsteps by entering the world of professional wrestling.

item.title: Parents 'devastated' as their babies are stranded during pandemic
item.description: Born amidst the Covid-19 pandemic, many surrogate babies in Ukraine have been left stranded by the lockdown and travel restrictions. CNN shows the inside of a facility in Kiev where more than 50 babies can't be collected by their legal parents. CNN's Matthew Chance reports.

item.title: Apple rolls out temperature checks and mask requirements as stores reopen
item.description: Shopping at Apple stores will be a drastically different experience when the company reopens the more than 500 global locations it closed in response to the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Husband of missing Colorado woman says he'll do 'whatever it takes' to bring wife back
item.description: As the search continues for Suzanne Morphew, a Colorado woman who vanished on Mother's Day, her husband posted an emotional plea on Facebook saying he would do "whatever it takes" to get her back.

item.title: Bids for rock legend's guitar start at $1M
item.description: A guitar Kurt Cobain played during Nirvana's 'MTV Unplugged in New York' live concert could sell for $1 million.

item.title: Another coronavirus record-breaker: World's shortest airline routes
item.description: The coronavirus pandemic has been the most financially disastrous force in the century-old history of commercial air travel.

item.title: Kim Kardashian launches face masks as part of Skims line
item.description: Kim Kardashian West has joined the fight against the coronavirus pandemic by launching a range of face masks.

item.title: Five tips to look more professional on a video conference
item.description: With more people working from home, video conferencing has become the new norm. These five tips will help make you look more professional on your video conference.

item.title: Some mud flows like lava on Mars, study says
item.description: The surface of Mars is covered in intriguing features that suggest hints about the planet's past and the water that once existed on its surface.

item.title: Premier League clubs vote in favor of returning to training as 'Project Restart' edges closer
item.description: The Premier League has edged closer to restarting as its clubs voted in favor of resuming training, while adhering to strict medical protocols outlined by the organization's 'Project Restart' plan.

item.title: Man alone at sea for 3 months emerges to a changed world
item.description: After spending months alone at sea, Canadian sailor Bill Norrie arrived in Christchurch, New Zealand, to find the world completely changed by the coronavirus pandemic. CNN affiliate TVNZ reports.

item.title: Age-proof your brain by keeping your heart healthy, study says
item.description: Managing your heart disease risk factors may help you avoid Alzheimer's and other dementias later in life, a study finds.

item.title: Snoop Dogg uses 'Frozen' to encourage people to 'let it go' -- and Idina Menzel responds
item.description: No matter his fame and notoriety, rapper Snoop Dogg proved that he's just like the rest of us -- he, too, sometimes needs to jam out to music in his car to relieve stress. But his choice of music might surprise you.

item.title: International Museum Day: Which museums around the world have reopened?
item.description: Since its founding in 1977, International Museum Day has been held every May 18 to celebrate museums as valuable spaces for cultural exchange.

item.title: University gives therapy dog an honorary degree
item.description: Moose, an 8-year-old therapy dog at Virginia Tech who has helped thousands of students cope with mental health issues, has received an honorary doctorate in veterinary medicine.

item.title: China backs coronavirus investigation on one condition
item.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping said he supports calls for an investigation into the handling of the coronavirus pandemic at a key summit Monday, but insisted that any inquiry should wait until the virus is contained.

item.title: Death toll nears 90,000
CNN anchor to Trump official: This is nothing to celebrate
item.description: CNN's Jake Tapper presses Health and Human Services Secretary Alex Azar about the high death toll in the US from Covid-19.

item.title: How Trump wins again, in 3 sentences
item.description: • ANALYSIS: Trump officials have new scapegoats for death toll • Trump looks to advance unfounded Obama crime conspiracy

item.title: Vaccine trial shows positive early results
item.description: • MARKETS LIVE: Dow soars on vaccine hope

item.title: CEO of Europe's largest airline calls UK quarantine plans 'idiotic'
item.description: The CEO of Europe's largest airline has slammed the UK government's handling of the coronavirus pandemic and described plans to impose a 14-day quarantine on international visitors as "idiotic and unimplementable."

item.title: This country's population is 50 million. It has limited ventilators
item.description: Kenya, a country of some 50 million people, is believed to have around 250 ventilators - and fewer than 20 people nationwide know how to operate them. CNN's Farai Sevenzo reports.
